captions.text: An orphan harbor seal
has just arrived at Dartmouth Vet
its a huge challenge for Hope
no baby seal has ever survived at Hope For Wild Life
A fisherman found this seal on a rocky outcrop out at sea
Hey Buddy!
isn't he sweet?
This seal is very young
The stump of its umbilical cord is still attached
a pup this small might have been born premature
Harbor seals also sometimes have twins
but they can only support one baby
the mother will abandon the one she thinks has less chance of survival
Dr Ian is one of our most experienced wildlife veterinarians
but this is the first time he has ever seen a seal pup this young
trying to get a decatherm in place there and see if we can get some warm fluid in him
The seal's body temperature is dangerously low
Dr Ian plans to give the seal some warm fluids intravenously
to raise it's temperature
I know but I am sorry
I know, its okay. Just a minute.
Its Okay
it know buddy, I am sorry, thats not fair.
we need to figure out some way to bring the seal's body temperature up
we are his only hope
